Arrangement.text:
CHORUS (x2): He put breath in my body I was life - less He gave grace to this heathen like Cy - rus I was sightless - He opened my eyelids Now I can treasure Christ price - less
VERSE 1: I feel the invincible One killing my sin Healing my wounds with the blood that He willingly shed I want the lifestyle - of a Christ child Lost in the waves till the cross was my lighthouse I feel the magnificent One nailed to the rack Hit with the lash to put righteousness on my back The war-cry of one born from the sky “Let the cross be the only thing caught by my eye” I feel the unbreakable One killing my lust Sweating drops like blood while He kneels in the dust LORD let me eyes behold the price that I owed As he lay in the garden and battles for my soul I feel the omnipotent One bring in the calm The perfect storm stilled while He lifts up His palm Now I drink living water till my sin is slaughtered Holding fast to the hope He’ll finish what He started
VERSE 2: I know the unstoppable One shows me His love I see it in Leviticus when they sprinkle the blood See I was born ruined, my heart is raw sewage And we were separated until He saw fluid I know the all-powerful One sees every flaw How I spurned and spit upon every law He had a plan though, to remove my punishment He sent the Mediator and made a New Covenant I know the unchangeable One gave up His Son To bring to completion the work He had begun The sacrificial system was only a shadow To take away sin you need more than some cattle But the Son is perfect, infinite and eternal So the Son can absorb a limitless inferno That’s what the Jews were missing, that’s who Messiah is The purpose of life is to treasure Him as priceless
